plugins.name: 혼용되는 외래어, 한자어 & 금용용어 사전
plugins.description:
혼용되는 외래어와 한자어, 어려운 금융 용어까지 한눈에!

이 서비스는 일상에서 자주 접하지만 정확히 알기 어려운 단어들을 쉽게 풀어주는 언어 가이드입니다.

단어의 출처, 의미, 바른 사용법은 물론, 대체 가능한 순우리말까지 함께 제공하여

더 정확하고 이해하기 쉬운 소통을 도와드립니다.


📘 외래어 vs 한자어 구분

💬 금융 용어 번역과 설명

🔍 혼동되는 표현 비교


언제나 쉽고, 누구나 알 수 있도록.

“이 단어, 정말 맞는 표현일까?” 고민될 땐, 지금 바로 검색하세요.


A guide to mixed foreign, Sino-Korean, and finance terms — all in one place.

This service helps you understand commonly used yet often confusing words with ease.

We offer origins, meanings, proper usage, and even alternative native Korean terms,

making communication clearer and more accurate.


📘 Distinguish foreign vs Sino-Korean terms

💬 Translate and simplify financial jargon

🔍 Compare confusing expressions side-by-side


Simple. Understandable. For everyone.

“Is this the right word to use?”

Just search and find out.

accepted.name: kenny
accepted.description: I am a designer who creates the tools and experiences that users truly need. I believe good design goes beyond visuals, flow and development.

plugins.tagline: 낯선 단어, 친절한 해석 (Confusing Words, Clear Meanings)

plugins.name: Awesome Bulk Metadata Importer
plugins.description:
Have you ever tried to add extra documentation to your Figma components, looking or better parity with your code or docs site? With this plugin, you can better utilize the Assets menu by searching components or icons by description or keywords.


This plugin checks a JSON file, and updates the alt text/description, synonym keywords, and link for all components and variants. Run this 1x for your entire library and stop wasting time manually updating metadata!


Sample CSV and JSON template
plugins.tagline: Bulk update your component descriptions, keywords, and docs link

135920.name: Awesome Bulk Metadata Importer
135920.description:
Have you ever tried to add extra documentation to your Figma components, looking or better parity with your code or docs site? With this plugin, you can better utilize the Assets menu by searching components or icons by description or keywords.


This plugin checks a JSON file, and updates the alt text/description, synonym keywords, and link for all components and variants. Run this 1x for your entire library and stop wasting time manually updating metadata!

135920.tagline: Bulk update your component descriptions, keywords, and docs link

plugins.name: Color Palette

Extract all solid fill and stroke colors from your document and generate a clean palette.

Perfect for creating design systems, documentation, or UI color audits.

One-click palette creation — no setup required.

Extract all solid fill and stroke colors from your document and generate a clean palette.

Perfect for creating design systems, documentation, or UI color audits.

One-click palette creation — no setup required.

plugins.name: Export hide text
plugins.description:
Appends a suffix to the name of the copied frame. If left blank, "COPY" will be used.

Copies the selected frame, applies the suffix, and hides text and UI components meant to be hidden in the duplicate.
plugins.tagline: Make ecports wio

135847.name: Export hide text
135847.description:
Appends a suffix to the name of the copied frame. If left blank, "COPY" will be used.

Copies the selected frame, applies the suffix, and hides text and UI components meant to be hidden in the duplicate.

plugins.name: Update Human Design Panel
plugins.description:
This plugin is part of a structured system for generating personalized Human Design maps in Figma.

It retrieves JSON data from an external endpoint and populates predefined fields in a frame named INPUT_PANEL.

To function properly, the file must include that frame and the relevant text layers.

This plugin is intended for use within a specific workflow, but may be adapted for similar use cases.
plugins.tagline: Automatically fill a data panel in your Figma file from a remote JSON source.

135810.name: Update Human Design Panel
135810.description:
This plugin is part of a structured system for generating personalized Human Design maps in Figma.

It retrieves JSON data from an external endpoint and populates predefined fields in a frame named INPUT_PANEL.

To function properly, the file must include that frame and the relevant text layers.

This plugin is intended for use within a specific workflow, but may be adapted for similar use cases.
135810.tagline: Automatically fill a data panel in your Figma file from a remote JSON source.

plugins.name: KColor.co
plugins.description:
KColor.co – The Free Smartest Color Tool for Designers

Create or get inspired with beautiful, accessible color palettes – all inside Figma. KColor.co brings essential tools into one sleek plugin:


Palette Generator: Instantly generate harmonious color sets in multiple modes (shades, tints, gradients, monochrome or Tailwind).


Contrast Checker: Test color combinations against WCAG 3 (APCA) standards to ensure readability and accessibility.


Color Blindness Simulator: See how your designs appear to users with different types of color blindness.


Export palettes to styles, variables or other formats.


Whether you are whipping up a fresh design or polishing the final pixels, KColor.co helps you work faster, smarter, and with accessibility baked in.
plugins.tagline: The Free Smartest Color Tool for Designers

136464.name: KColor.co
136464.description:
KColor.co – The Free Smartest Color Tool for Designers

Create or get inspired with beautiful, accessible color palettes – all inside Figma. KColor.co brings essential tools into one sleek plugin:


Palette Generator: Instantly generate harmonious color sets in multiple modes (shades, tints, gradients, monochrome or Tailwind).


Contrast Checker: Test color combinations against WCAG 3 (APCA) standards to ensure readability and accessibility.


Color Blindness Simulator: See how your designs appear to users with different types of color blindness.


Export palettes to styles, variables or other formats.


Whether you are whipping up a fresh design or polishing the final pixels, KColor.co helps you work faster, smarter, and with accessibility baked in.
136464.tagline: The Free Smartest Color Tool for Designers

plugins.name: Content Magic Filler with OpenAI
plugins.description:
1. Select one or more layers in your Figma file (the plugin will find all text layers within your selection).
  2. Open the plugin and enter your OpenAI API key. If you don't have one: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/4936850-where-do-i-find-my-openai-api-key
  3. Type a prompt or instruction describing the kind of text you want (e.g., “US zip code”, “company name”, “city in Japan”).
  4. Click "Generate Text". Each selected text layer will be filled with a unique, AI-generated response matching your instruction.
plugins.tagline: Instantly fill your Figma text layers with smart, unique AI-generated content.

135957.name: Content Magic Filler with OpenAI
135957.description:
1. Select one or more layers in your Figma file (the plugin will find all text layers within your selection).
  2. Open the plugin and enter your OpenAI API key. If you don't have one: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/4936850-where-do-i-find-my-openai-api-key
  3. Type a prompt or instruction describing the kind of text you want (e.g., “US zip code”, “company name”, “city in Japan”).
  4. Click "Generate Text". Each selected text layer will be filled with a unique, AI-generated response matching your instruction.

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin needs to communicate with OpenAI's API to generate AI-powered text content for selected layers in Figma.

135957.tagline: Instantly fill your Figma text layers with smart, unique AI-generated content.

plugins.name: STREET Design Toolkit
plugins.description:
This plugin was built to support the designers at Street; however, you might also find it useful.


It includes the following features:

•Address Generator

•Name Generator

•Business Generator

•Contact Generator

•Number Generator – decimal, currency, etc.

•Date/Time Generator
plugins.tagline: Toolkit for the Designers at Street!

135634.name: STREET Design Toolkit
135634.description:
This plugin was built to support the designers at Street; however, you might also find it useful.


It includes the following features:

•Address Generator

•Name Generator

•Business Generator

•Contact Generator

•Number Generator – decimal, currency, etc.

•Date/Time Generator
135634.release_notes:
✨ More Realistic Street Numbers
No more repetitive numbers! We've fixed the issue with too many double digits (like 22, 33, 44)
Expanded range - Addresses now include numbers in the hundreds (100+)
UK addresses improved with more authentic numbering patterns

🌟 Better Address Variety
More natural feel to generated addresses with varied number patterns
Added popular UK streets including Abbey Road, Oxford Street, and Baker Street
Smarter generation that creates more believable address combinations
135634.tagline: Toolkit for the Designers at Street!

plugins.name: Riido
plugins.description:
디자인과 개발 사이, 더 이상 끊기지 않는 협업


피그마와 뤼이도를 연동해 디자이너와 개발자의 작업 흐름을 자연스럽게 연결하세요.

디자이너는 더 이상 뤼이도에 직접 들어가 작업 상태를 수정할 필요 없이, 피그마에서 디자인 작업만 해도 자동으로 뤼이도에 최신 상태가 반영됩니다.

개발자는 언제 어떤 디자인이 완료되었는지 실시간으로 확인할 수 있어, 놓치지 않고 바로 개발을 시작할 수 있습니다.


주요 기능


🔗 Figma 디자인과 작업을 연결

작업과 연결된 프레임, 섹션, 페이지를 플러그인에서 바로 확인할 수 있습니다.

연결된 작업을 클릭하면 해당 디자인으로 이동할 수 있어 맥락 파악이 쉬워집니다.


🔄 Figma에서 바로 작업 상태 업데이트

디자인이 완료되면, Figma 안에서 작업 상태를 ‘완료’로 변경할 수 있어 매번 뤼이도에 접속하지 않아도 됩니다.


🧭 작업 히스토리와 현재 상태 추적

플러그인 안에서 작업 목록, 상태, 담당자, 우선순위 등을 한눈에 확인할 수 있어,

디자인과 개발 간에 엇갈림 없이 협업할 수 있습니다


뤼이도와 피그마의 유기적인 연결로

더 빠른 작업 전달, 더 적은 커뮤니케이션 비용, 더 집중된 업무를 경험해보세요.
plugins.tagline: 디자인과 개발 사이, 더 이상 끊기지 않는 협업

136545.name: Riido
136545.description:

🧭 작업 히스토리와 현재 상태 추적

플러그인 안에서 작업 목록, 상태, 담당자, 우선순위 등을 한눈에 확인할 수 있어,

디자인과 개발 간에 엇갈림 없이 협업할 수 있습니다


뤼이도와 피그마의 유기적인 연결로

더 빠른 작업 전달, 더 적은 커뮤니케이션 비용, 더 집중된 업무를 경험해보세요.

plugins.name: JSON Frame Mapper
plugins.description:
# JSON Frame Mapper: Figma Plugin


## Main use case


You have a number of items with data in a collection as a single source of truth.


You also have a Figma design which you would like to use as a template.


You would like to create as many items as you have in your collection, with the data from each item using your Figma design as a template.


Wouldn't it be useful to map the data to the template, press a button and - BAM! - loads of content based on the template with the data from your collection?


I think so.


---


This plugin is completely free so feel free to not buy me a [coffee](https://buymeacoffee.com/shragor)


Although... if you did, you could leave a message asking for functional upgrades which I would consider 🤔


---


## How the thing works


1. Install the plugin in Figma (you should know how to do this)

2. Pick the frame you want to use as a template

3. Alter the fieldNames you want populated with your JSON data - note, change the name of the field, not the value - by surrounding them like {{this}}

4. Open the plugin (you can do this at any time tbh)

5. Click "Load JSON File" to load your JSON file (check next section for the required format)

6. If your frame is not selected, select it by clicking its name

7. JSON Frame Mapper will attempt to map {{fieldNames}} to Fields

8. You can manually change the mapping of fieldNames to JSON fields if you want to

9. Set "Generation Settings". Frames are generated from left to right starting from the right of the template (so make sure you have room!)

10. Frame separation sets the number of pixels between generated frames

11. Max horizontal frames sets the maximum number of frames generated to the right before it moves to a new line below the first generated frames

12. The "Generate Frames" button is there but I don't remember why. Give it a shot and see if anything happens


---


## The data


Currently the **JSON Frame Mapper** accepts only a JSON in this form:


```

[

{

"name": [Item 1's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

{

"name": [Item 2's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

...

]

```


So, an array of objects with key/value pairs or fields of whatever you want to call them.


In my use case, the keys correspond to column headings in a spreadsheet I output to JSON. Each row beneath the column headings is a single item I want to use with the template.


---


## Other stuff


- The plugin will look for a JSON field of "name", "Name", "title" or "Title" and use it as the name for the generated frame

- On successfully loading a JSON, it will display the number of items and fields such as ```25 items with 23 fields loaded```

- It looks for {{fieldNames}} whenever a frame is selected so you can deselect or select another frame/template after the JSON is loaded

- You can't load another or different JSON once you have loaded the first one. Unfortunately, the only way you can change JSON once loaded is:

1. Closing the Plugin

2. Exiting Figma

3. Uninstalling Figma

4. Uninstalling Windows or if Mac, upgrade your Mac to the latest silicon

5. Reinstalling Windows or opening your new Mac

6. Installing Figma

7. Installing JSON Frame Mapper Plugin

8. Opening the Plugin

- Note: only steps 1 and 8 are required for most people to clear the JSON file


## Similar plugins I tried and didn't like


- JSON -> content

- Google Sheets Sync

- Google Sheets → Figma

- Data Lab

- Google Sheets Sync

- Data Populator

- others I can't remember


## Language clarification


You *probably* don't need to read this.


*Frame* = A Figma frame, you should know what this is. It will contain your Template


*Template* = A frame where you have all the design done and text fields in place but need lots of versions of each with different text (which is in your JSON file)


*fieldNames* = The name for a field/text field etc. in your Figma Frame/Template. Some of these will contain the text you want lots of different versions of


*Item* = An individual thing in your JSON file which contains many Fields each with the data you want to map to your fieldNames and add to your Template


*Fields* = These are the names/titles/keys of the data in your JSON. Each Item will have one or more of these and each Field can be mapped to none, one or many fieldNames in the Template


*Value* = The actual value for a given Field of a given Item in your JSON. Hopefully, this will eventually appear in a Template if everything goes well


*Map* = Linking of a fieldName to a Field
plugins.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data

136042.name: JSON Frame Mapper
136042.description:
# JSON Frame Mapper: Figma Plugin


## Main use case


You have a number of items with data in a collection as a single source of truth.


You also have a Figma design which you would like to use as a template.


You would like to create as many items as you have in your collection, with the data from each item using your Figma design as a template.

I think so.


---

Although... if you did, you could leave a message asking for functional upgrades which I would consider 🤔


---


## How the thing works


1. Install the plugin in Figma (you should know how to do this)

2. Pick the frame you want to use as a template

3. Alter the fieldNames you want populated with your JSON data - note, change the name of the field, not the value - by surrounding them like {{this}}

4. Open the plugin (you can do this at any time tbh)

5. Click "Load JSON File" to load your JSON file (check next section for the required format)

6. If your frame is not selected, select it by clicking its name

7. JSON Frame Mapper will attempt to map {{fieldNames}} to Fields

8. You can manually change the mapping of fieldNames to JSON fields if you want to

9. Set "Generation Settings". Frames are generated from left to right starting from the right of the template (so make sure you have room!)

10. Frame separation sets the number of pixels between generated frames

11. Max horizontal frames sets the maximum number of frames generated to the right before it moves to a new line below the first generated frames

12. The "Generate Frames" button is there but I don't remember why. Give it a shot and see if anything happens


---


## The data


Currently the **JSON Frame Mapper** accepts only a JSON in this form:


```

[

{

"name": [Item 1's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

{

"name": [Item 2's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

...

]

```


So, an array of objects with key/value pairs or fields of whatever you want to call them.


In my use case, the keys correspond to column headings in a spreadsheet I output to JSON. Each row beneath the column headings is a single item I want to use with the template.


---


## Other stuff


- The plugin will look for a JSON field of "name", "Name", "title" or "Title" and use it as the name for the generated frame

- On successfully loading a JSON, it will display the number of items and fields such as ```25 items with 23 fields loaded```

- It looks for {{fieldNames}} whenever a frame is selected so you can deselect or select another frame/template after the JSON is loaded

- You can't load another or different JSON once you have loaded the first one. Unfortunately, the only way you can change JSON once loaded is:

1. Closing the Plugin

2. Exiting Figma

3. Uninstalling Figma

4. Uninstalling Windows or if Mac, upgrade your Mac to the latest silicon

5. Reinstalling Windows or opening your new Mac

6. Installing Figma

7. Installing JSON Frame Mapper Plugin

8. Opening the Plugin

- Note: only steps 1 and 8 are required for most people to clear the JSON file


## Similar plugins I tried and didn't like


- JSON -> content

- Google Sheets Sync

- Google Sheets → Figma

- Data Lab

- Google Sheets Sync

- Data Populator

- others I can't remember


## Language clarification


You *probably* don't need to read this.


*Frame* = A Figma frame, you should know what this is. It will contain your Template


*Template* = A frame where you have all the design done and text fields in place but need lots of versions of each with different text (which is in your JSON file)


*fieldNames* = The name for a field/text field etc. in your Figma Frame/Template. Some of these will contain the text you want lots of different versions of


*Item* = An individual thing in your JSON file which contains many Fields each with the data you want to map to your fieldNames and add to your Template


*Fields* = These are the names/titles/keys of the data in your JSON. Each Item will have one or more of these and each Field can be mapped to none, one or many fieldNames in the Template


*Value* = The actual value for a given Field of a given Item in your JSON. Hopefully, this will eventually appear in a Template if everything goes well


*Map* = Linking of a fieldName to a Field

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin allows users to load images and data from their local development servers. Users often run local servers on common ports (3000, 4000, 5000, 8000, 8080, 9000) to serve images, SVG files, and JSON data that they want to import into their Figma designs. Localhost access enables seamless integration with local development workflows and self-hosted content.

136042.release_notes:
Added support for images and colours!

- Plugin now looks for {{named}} objects not just text - e.g. rectangles, circles
- So each Detected Field now has a type: either text or object
- Text-type fields can receive either text (predictably), colour or an image URL (all interpreted as text)
- Object-types fields can only receive a hex colour or image URL (mapping is restricted to ensure this)
- Images of type jpg, png and gif are recognised and compatible
- The image is added as the object's fill
- Plugin does recognise SVG Fields in the JSON (i.e. a URL with .svg extension) but it proved tiresome and finicky to implement so they are not imported
- URL is a bit awkward with CORS. I have mine stored locally and so set up a server with `http-server -p 8000 --cors` in the directory of my images
- External sites that should work are: amazonaws.com", cloudinary.com", unsplash.com", pexels.com", imgur.com"
- Colours! JSON field values can be hex colours (e.g. #1C1C1C). If applied to an object-type field, the object will be changed to that colour
- A few other tweaks and under-the-hood changes
136042.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data

plugins.name: Lazer
plugins.description:
Lazer is a plugin for Figma that provides quick commands to adjust the layout and appearance properties of selected elements. It is somewhat opinionated.


The idea is to leave the keyboard less by creating pseudo shortcuts. By bringing up the Actions input with command + K or command + / and then typing a short code (eg. w.h), the fuzzy search will bring your focus to an action you can execute by pressing enter.


I used Gemini 2.5 Pro to build this.


Features

This plugin allows you to quickly adjust:


Width & Height

w.h - Set Width to Hug

h.h - Set Height to Hug

w.f - Set Width to Fill

h.f - Set Height to Fill

w.. - Set Width (prompts for custom value)

h.. - Set Height (prompts for custom value)


Padding

p.0 - Set All Padding to 0

p.16 - Set All Padding to 16

p.. - Set Padding (prompts for custom value)


Auto Layout

al.. - Set Auto Layout Alignment (opens alignment UI)

al.h - Set Auto Layout to Horizontal

al.v - Set Auto Layout to Vertical

g.0 - Set Gap to 0

g.8 - Set Gap to 8

g.16 - Set Gap to 16

g.. - Set Gap (prompts for custom value)


Border Radius

br.0 - Set Border Radius to 0px

br.8 - Set Border Radius to 8px

br.. - Set Border Radius (prompts for custom value)


Stroke

s.0 - Set Stroke Width to 0

s.1 - Set Stroke Width to 1

sw.. - Set Stroke Width (prompts for custom value)

sc.. - Set Stroke Colour (prompts for custom value)


Fill

f.1 - Add White Fill

f.0 - Remove All Fills

f.. - Set Fill Colour (prompts for custom value)


Text

ls.. - Set Text Letter Spacing (prompts for custom value)

t.s - Set Text Size (prompts for custom value)


General

help! - Show Commands and Shortcuts (displays this list in a popup)


Usage

  1. Open the Actions input with command + K or command + /
  2. Type the short code for the command (eg. w.h)
  3. Press enter (assuming you have your desired command in focus)


* Many commands apply adjustments directly (e.g., w.h - Set Width to Hug).

* The al.. - Set Auto Layout Alignment command will open a dialog for visual alignment selection.

* Commands ending with .. (e.g., p.. - Set Padding) will prompt you to enter a custom value.
plugins.tagline: Shortcuts as quick actions to help you Figma faster

plugins.name: Name Shame
plugins.description:
Name Shame is a lovingly vibe-coded plugin born from one designer’s deep-seated frustration with default layer names like “Rectangle 123” and “Group 87.” Instead of silently suffering, I decided to roast my own poor file hygiene—and now yours too.


This plugin scans your Figma file for default-named layers, serves up a spicy roast for each offender, and lets you rename them with beautifully ridiculous alternatives like “such_lazy” or “identity_crisis.” Use it for laughs, use it for cleanup, use it because your future self deserves better.


File hygiene matters. Might as well make it fun. 🎉

accepted.name: Aaron May
accepted.description:
Professional & Punchy
Creative Director with a love for design systems, clear UI, and a well-organized layer panel.

plugins.tagline: Scans bland layer names, dishes witty roasts and renames them with delightful absurdity

plugins.name: BrowserLens
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you import color styles from the BrowserLens web extension. Insert colors as layers in your design and add palettes to your local styles.


Learn more about BrowserLens: https://browserlens.com/

Documentation: https://docs.browserlens.com/


How to Use

  1. Open any webpage with the BrowserLens extension.
  2. Click export > Figma (BrowserLens Plugin).
  3. Download the style file for Figma.
  4. Run this plugin and upload the style file.
  5. Choose whether to add colors as local styles.
  6. Click 'Import Styles'.


About BrowserLens


BrowserLens is a web extension designed to extract styling and seo information from any webpage without the need for developer tools. It provides a simple UI for extracting and copying webpage information from the current tab.


Extension Features

  1. ⌨️ View fonts used on a webpage and the associated CSS values.
  2. 🖌️ Extract colors from a webpage and click to copy color value.
  3. 🌅 Extract gradients from a webpage and click to copy CSS value.
  4. 🎨 Export color palettes to Figma.
  5. 🌐 Preview SEO data including page meta, OpenGraph tags and Twitter Card data.
  6. ✅ Check SEO meta for best practices including title and description length.
  7. 🖼️ List all images present on a page and click to download, including background images.
  8. 🌃 Dark mode support.

accepted.name: BrowserLens

plugins.name: SnapCap
plugins.description:
Capture screenshots from any webpage and instantly send them to your FigJam board or Figma Design file in a single click, making it easier than ever to document user experiences as you browse the web.


Please note that to use SnapCap, you will also need to install the companion Chrome extension at snapcap.app/extension


How to Use SnapCap

Installation

  1. Install the Figma plugin
  2. Install the Chrome browser extension, and pin it


Session Setup

  1. Open the FigJam board or Figma Design file where you wish to send screenshots
  2. Launch the Figma plugin and click "Start new session"
  3. Copy the generated session code
  4. Click on the SnapCap browser extension and enter the copied session code


Taking Screenshots

Once your session has connected, click on the SnapCap browser extension anytime you want to take a screenshot and send it to your Figma file. A check mark will be shown on the extension icon to indicate that the screenshot was captured successfully, and it will show up moments later in the Figma file where the FigCap plugin is running.


Ending Session

When you are done taking screenshots, click the End button. If the SnapCap browser extension does not automatically disconnect, you can right click on the extension icon and select "End session"


Demo video and more at www.snapcap.app/
plugins.tagline: Capture screenshots from any webpage and instantly send them to your Figma files

134331.name: SnapCap
134331.description:

Ending Session

When you are done taking screenshots, click the End button. If the SnapCap browser extension does not automatically disconnect, you can right click on the extension icon and select "End session"


Demo video and more at www.snapcap.app/

plugins.name: Long side scaling
plugins.description:
Tired of manually resizing images within frames one by one, especially when you need them to fit a specific maximum dimension while keeping their aspect ratio? "Long Side Scaling" automates this task!


What this plugin does:

  1. It finds the first visible Rectangle node with an Image fill inside each selected Frame.
  2. It takes the dimension you provide (e.g., 1040px).
  3. It identifies whether the image's width or height is larger (the "longest side").
  4. It then proportionally resizes the image so that its longest side exactly matches the dimension you entered.


How to use:

  1. Select one or more Frames containing the images you want to resize.
  2. Run the "Long Side Scaling" plugin from the Plugins menu.
  3. The plugin window will show how many selected frames contain a suitable image.
  4. Enter the desired dimension (in pixels) for the longest side into the input field.
  5. Click the "Start" button.
  6. The images within the selected frames will be resized instantly!


Key Benefits:

  1. Batch Processing: Saves time by resizing images in multiple frames at once.
  2. Proportional Scaling: Guarantees your images won't be stretched or distorted.
  3. Consistent Sizing: Perfect for creating uniform image galleries, grids, or ensuring images don't exceed a maximum width or height.
  4. Simple Interface: Easy to use with just one input and one button.


Important Note:

This plugin specifically targets the first visible Rectangle node with an Image fill it finds directly within each selected Frame. Images inside groups within the frame, or images applied as fills to shapes other than Rectangles, will not be affected.
plugins.tagline: Scale images proportionally by their longest side.

130386.name: Long side scaling
130386.description:

Important Note:

This plugin specifically targets the first visible Rectangle node with an Image fill it finds directly within each selected Frame. Images inside groups within the frame, or images applied as fills to shapes other than Rectangles, will not be affected.
130386.tagline: Scale images proportionally by their longest side.

  1. Directly set the fill color of the Sticky.
  2. It is also able to set the color of the text within the Sticky.
  3. You can set the color for a single Sticky node, or for multiple selected Sticky nodes. Even more, you can directly select an area, and the plugin will automatically identify the Sticky nodes within the selected area and change their colors as well as the colors of the text.
130221.tagline: Custom the color of sticky and sticky text

plugins.name: AI Brand Guide
plugins.description:
AI Brand Guide transforms your design files into comprehensive, professional brand guides in seconds. Extract and organize design elements from your Figma files to create beautiful, developer-friendly documentation.


Key Features

  1. Intelligent Design Element Categorization: Automatically organizes your elements into Buttons, Icons, and Other Elements based on naming patterns
  2. Multi-Frame Export: Choose between Single Frame (all sections in one scrollable frame) or Separate Frames (each section in its own dedicated frame)
  3. Color Palette Extraction: Automatically extracts colors from your selection with detailed RGB, HEX, and HSL values
  4. AI-Powered Color Naming: Generate professional, creative names for your color palette with a single click
  5. Color Theory Generation: Create comprehensive color theory documentation including palette overview, color roles, visual qualities, and usage recommendations
  6. Typography Hierarchy System: Extracts and organizes typography into a structured system with Header and Paragraph classifications
  7. Component Documentation: Displays detailed specifications for buttons, icons and other elements including exact dimensions and padding values
  8. Visual Previews: Generates thumbnail previews for all design elements
  9. Form Element Detection: Special handling for contact forms and other form elements with improved display


How It Works

  1. Select your design elements in Figma (frames, components, or entire pages)
  2. Generate your brand guide with a single click
  3. Customize your guide: Rename colors, add color theory, or organize elements
  4. Export to Figma: Choose your preferred layout style and generate a complete brand guide directly in your Figma file


Element Categorization

For best results, use these naming patterns:

  1. Buttons: Include "btn" or "button" in the name (e.g., "btn-primary", "submit-button")
  2. Icons: Include "icn" or "icon" in the name (e.g., "icn-home", "arrow-icon")
  3. Other Elements: Include "element" or "other" in the name (e.g., "card-element", "other-banner")


What's Included in Your Brand Guide

  1. Color Palette: Complete color documentation with visual swatches and color codes
  2. Typography System: Organized type hierarchy with font details and visual examples
  3. Buttons Collection: All button variants with exact dimensions and padding specifications
  4. Icon Library: Organized icon set with dimensions and specifications
  5. Additional Elements: Cards, banners, forms and other UI components with detailed measurements
  6. Color Theory: Optional section providing insights on palette psychology, symbolism and usage


AI Brand Guide helps design teams maintain consistency while giving developers the exact specifications they need to implement designs accurately.
plugins.tagline: Transform designs into comprehensive brand guides with AI-powered color intelligence.

plugins.name: LARA for Figma
plugins.description:
LARA is the flagship product of Lithero, the first AI company to design and build products specifically for pharma marketing teams. LARA is a custom-made AI that learns the nuances of pharma brands at lightspeed, supporting brand teams throughout the end-to-end content creation process.


The official LARA for Figma plugin brings the power of LARA Screen and LARA Claims to your workspace. Get actionable feedback on the compliance of your content at the point of creation, saving significant time downstream. LARA for Figma complements the content creation process by ensuring high quality and accuracy of created content. Shorten review cycles, reduce spend, and get the most out of Figma with LARA!


Key Features:

Claims

- Detect differences between created content and approved claims, enabling corrections before MLR

- Trace claims back to their references and associated safety text in LARA Claims for additional context


Safety Text

- Identify and insert any required safety text missing from the content

- Generate accurate & complete safety text blocks to insert into content


References

- Find potential approved references that could be used to substantiate claims

- Locate any claims that are missing citations to typically seen references


*Requires subscription to LARA Claims and Screen. For more information, visit https://www.lithero.com/
plugins.tagline: Bring the power of LARA to your process

136539.description:
